text.section: This section applies only in Dorchester County.

section.section: Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, the Board of License Commissioners may issue a beer and wine sampling or tasting (BWST) license to a holder of a Class A license to hold tastings or samplings of beer or wine.
A holder of a Class A beer license may use a BWST license to hold tastings or samplings of beer only.
A BWST license authorizes sampling or tasting of alcoholic beverages only on the licensed premises of the holder of a Class A license.
The alcoholic beverages shall be offered to consumers at no charge.

text.section:
A person may consume alcoholic beverages covered by a BWST license in a quantity not exceeding:
1 ounce from a single brand of wine; and
4 ounces from all brands of wine in a single day; and
3 ounces from a single brand of beer; and
8 ounces from all brands of beer in a single day.

section.section: An application for a BWST license shall be made on a form supplied by the Board of License Commissioners.
A BWST license may be issued without a public hearing.

If an initial application for a BWST license is denied:
The applicant may resubmit the application; and
On request from the applicant, the Board shall hold a public hearing on the application before determining whether to issue the license.
A renewal of a BWST license may be made at the time the holder's Class A license is renewed.

text.section:
The fee for a BWST license is:
$150 for not more than 15 beer or wine tastings per year; or
$250 for not more than 30 beer or wine tastings per year.

section.section: The Board of License Commissioners may not require the publication of an application for a BWST license before issuing the license.
The holder of a BWST license shall notify the Board in writing at least 7 days before the event at which the license is to be used.

text.section: At the end of the day for which a BWST license is valid, the holder of the license shall properly dispose of alcoholic beverages that remain in a container opened for tasting or sampling.
